text:
hi, I’m trying to listen to `message` events from embedded HubSpot forms, as described in <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>
```document.addEventListener('message', e => console.log(e));```
however, this doesn’t seem to work - the event listener callback never triggers. is this a still supported feature?

ah, I’ve tried logging all events (native and custom alike) on `window` and `document` , and seems that these events aren’t being fired anymore. it’d be nice if the HubSpot team reconsidered this, as these events seem very useful

as my use case is to shift the layout when a HubSpot dropdown form appears, alternatives seem to include using a mutationobserver on `body` or hooking to `animationstart` and checking whether the event target matches a HubSpot selector
